title: Analysed : Kane overtakes Greaves , Liverpool huge issue , Balogun the real deal
body_text:
Another weekend of European football is complete, and we are not short of talking points.
Arsenal‚Äôs 13-game unbeaten run in the league came to an end at Goodison Park, Harry Kane‚Äôs winner for Tottenham Hotspur broke an all-time club goalscoring record and Liverpool‚Äôs poor form continued with a seventh league defeat of the season.
Advertisement
On the continent, an Arsenal loanee is having the season of his career in France, a Real Madrid winger set an unwanted record for the season, and things ‚Äî unusually ‚Äî are very tight at the top in the German Bundesliga.
Let‚Äôs spin the data wheel and get your week off to a numerically delightful start.
Kane leads the way for Spurs
There is nowhere else to begin.
Harry Kane scored the only goal of the game as Tottenham Hotspur beat champions Manchester City 1-0 in the Premier League on Sunday, but his celebrations were not limited to the result.
The goal was his 267th in all competitions for Spurs, breaking the club‚Äôs all-time record held by Jimmy Greaves since 1970. It was also Kane‚Äôs 200th Premier League goal, putting him just eight behind Wayne Rooney and with Alan Shearer‚Äôs Premier League record of 260 absolutely in his sights at age 29. (Including pre-Premier League era games, my The Athletic colleague Shearer got 283 top-flight goals in his career).
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard to put into words and I‚Äôm so glad it came in a win,‚Äù said Kane. ‚ÄúTo do it in front of the home fans is a moment I‚Äôll never forget. There has been so much talk about it over the last couple of weeks, I wanted to get it done as soon as possible, so to do it in a big game, against one of the best teams in the world, it‚Äôs a special feeling.‚Äù
If you are looking for a deeper dive into Kane‚Äôs goalscoring evolution to reach his record-breaking tally, The Athletic has you covered.
To rotate or not to rotate
Given their contrasting fortunes in recent weeks, Everton‚Äôs 1-0 win over league leaders Arsenal at Goodison Park was one of the notable shocks of the weekend.
Sean Dyche picked his first starting line-up as Everton manager, while Mikel Arteta named an unchanged starting XI for Arsenal ‚Äî and not for the first time this season.
Advertisement
Aside from injuries, Arsenal‚Äôs XI has been picking itself for months, with Arteta sending out the same team that started the previous fixture on 10 occasions this season, which is more than any Premier League side.
A settled line-up is rarely a bad thing, but could Arsenal be in danger of becoming too predictable to their opponents?
Arteta brought in Leandro Trossard and Jorginho in January to freshen up the squad for their push for the title, and Arsenal might benefit from a greater element of surprise in the coming weeks ‚Äî be that tactical or personnel-based.
GO DEEPER
Arsenal have shown why they could win the title - at Everton we saw why they might not
At the other end of the scale, Graham Potter hit shuffle once again for Chelsea on Friday evening, handing starting debuts to new signings Mykhailo Mudryk and Enzo Fernandez in their 0-0 draw with neighbours Fulham.
Potter has now made 64 changes to his starting line-up in the Premier League since he replaced Thomas Tuchel in mid-September, which is more than any other team in the division.
Much has been made of Chelsea‚Äôs spending this season and, amid the glut of options available, Potter is still searching for the best formula among his squad to pick a consistent starting XI.
Changes have been the order of the day for Potter, but things are not going smoothly at Stamford Bridge.
Balogun flying high in France
While Arsenal will want to forget all about their weekend, one player on their books has had a week to remember.
Folarin Balogun‚Äôs loan spell at Reims has been a huge success so far, as the 21-year-old continues to set France‚Äôs Ligue 1 alight.
While the goalless draw away to Auxerre on Sunday was a little less thrilling, Balogun must still be happy with his week‚Äôs work having netted his first senior hat-trick in a 4-2 home victory over Lorient on Wednesday ‚Äî with his third goal being the pick of the bunch.
My first professional hat trick üôèüèª. Merci l'√©quipe pic.twitter.com/hxn4QhSNUw
‚Äî Balogun (@balogun) February 2, 2023
That‚Äôs now 14 league goals in 21 appearances for Balogun, and what is most encouraging is how sustainable his output looks, with his 10 non-penalty goals scored aligning closely with his non-penalty expected goals (10.5) this season.
More pertinently, that total makes the England Under-21 striker the leading scorer in the French top division, with more goals than all of Paris Saint-Germain‚Äôs superstar trio Kylian Mbappe, Neymar and Lionel Messi so far, helping Reims stretch their unbeaten run to 16 games under manager Will Still.
Tres bien, Folarin.
Advertisement
Liverpool far too open against counter-attacks
For Liverpool fans, Saturday‚Äôs 3-0 defeat away at Wolves was less of a surprise than it should have been.
Jurgen Klopp‚Äôs men have now conceded three goals in each of their last three away games in the Premier League, bringing their total goals conceded tally to 28 in 20 games ‚Äî more than they allowed in the whole of the 2021-22 league season (26) and as many as their next opponents, neighbours Everton, who started the weekend joint-bottom of the table.
Klopp must feel like he‚Äôs living out Groundhog Day each time his side takes the field.
GO DEEPER
'Absolutely horrible': The problems facing Liverpool in the biggest crisis of Klopp's reign
Liverpool conceded first for the 12th time in those 20 Premier League outings this season, and despite spells of territorial dominance in the second half, they were sucker-punched once again by a counter-attacking sequence for Wolves‚Äô third goal with 20 minutes to go.
That means that Liverpool have now let in five goals from counter-attacks this season, which is more than each of the last six seasons ‚Äî the closest being three goals they allowed that way en route to winning the 2019-20 title.
Trending the number of direct attacks Liverpool concede per game ‚Äî which is defined as a possession that starts in a team‚Äôs defensive half and results in a shot or touch inside the opposition penalty area within 15 seconds ‚Äî we can see just how open Liverpool have been once they lose the ball.
Eleven points off the top four and with a Champions League last-16 tie against holders Real Madrid looming, Liverpool‚Äôs slump needs to end quickly if they are to salvage their season.
The Bundesliga is competitive again
Bayern Munich‚Äôs 4-2 away win over Wolfsburg got them back to winning ways, after three consecutive 1-1 league draws following the season‚Äôs post-World Cup resumption saw them attract criticism in Germany.
Advertisement
Sunday‚Äôs victory edges them one point ahead of Union Berlin (who beat Mainz a day earlier) after 19 games, with the Bundesliga table looking as tight as it has for a long time at this stage of the season.
Just six points separate Freiburg in sixth (34) from leaders Bayern (40), making the title race as closely run as in 2019-20 when RB Leipzig were top, also on 40 points after the same number of games.
Of course, Bayern fought back to win the league that year, and they have been champions in each of the past 10 seasons in Germany, but just when you thought the Bundesliga might be dead, it throws you a lifeline.
It is nice of Bayern to give others a chance this season, although the odds to win the title still look very much stacked in their favour.
Using FiveThirtyEight‚Äôs predicted league table ‚Äî which forecasts the outcome of each of the remaining fixtures based on the strength of the respective teams to simulate how the season might end ‚Äî Bayern‚Äôs 86 per cent probability to win the title again from here is rather overwhelming.
Could Leipzig, Borussia Dortmund or cult favourites Union push them all the way?
Keep a close eye on events in Germany in the coming months.
Palhinha adds bite to Fulham‚Äôs season
Fulham‚Äôs first season back in the top flight has wildly exceeded most of their fans‚Äô expectations.
That 0-0 draw with Chelsea on Friday was their third clean sheet in four away Premier League games ‚Äî as many as they managed in their previous 15 matches on the road ‚Äî and their defensive solidity was largely thanks to midfield destroyer Joao Palhinha.
The 27-year-old Portugal international is one of the signings of the season so far, adding steel to Fulham with his ability to break up the opposition attack and stick a foot in where necessary.
So much so that no player in Europe‚Äôs top five domestic leagues has made more tackles than Palhinha‚Äôs 98. Broadening this out to his ‚Äútrue‚Äù tackles made ‚Äî which include tackles, fouls committed and challenges lost ‚Äî only Manchester United‚Äôs Casemiro averages more than his 10.4 per 1,000 opponent touches.
Palhinha has played the second-most minutes of any Fulham player this season (behind only Tim Ream) and his destructive displays have helped ensure that Fulham‚Äôs total of 32 points from the first 22 top-flight games has only been bettered once in their history (1959-60).
Advertisement
Vinicius Junior sets an unwanted record
It was a weekend to forget in more ways than one for Vinicius Jr, not least as his Real Madrid side slumped to a 1-0 loss away to Mallorca ‚Äî they are now eight points adrift of La Liga leaders Barcelona, who won 3-0 at home to Sevilla later in the day.
GO DEEPER
La Liga to investigate after Vinicius Jr subject to racist abuse at Mallorca match
Vinicius Jr will be (quite literally) nursing his wounds, as he was fouled 10 times on the day ‚Äî the most that a single player has suffered in any game across Europe‚Äôs top five domestic leagues this season.
Controversies on and off the field have surrounded Vinicius Jr in recent months, but team-mate Nacho was quick to condemn the situation.
‚ÄúI think an atmosphere is being created with the issue of Vinicius that does not favour anyone, neither Vinicius nor anyone else,‚Äù the defender said after the game. ‚ÄúThe public is getting involved with the boy without knowing why. We have to leave controversy and nonsense aside.‚Äù
Vinicius has been fouled 79 times in La Liga this season ‚Äî comfortably the highest of any player across Europe, with Neymar of PSG (59) closest to him. His skilful style on the ball is naturally going to attract players towards him, but 10 fouls suffered in a single game was the most by a Real Madrid player in almost a decade.
At least he‚Äôs getting use out of his shin pads.
(Main graphic ‚Äî photo: Getty Images/design: Sam Richardson)
